SENT.plain: An 18-year-old man presented with BehÃ§et's disease and two large bilateral pulmonary artery aneurysms
The day following aneurysmorrhaphy of the right aneurysm, a massive hemoptysis led to death
Postmortem examination disclosed rupture of the left aneurysm in a segmental bronchus
The aneurysms had inflammatory walls and were associated with organized pulmonary arterial thromboses and endomyocardial fibrosis of the right ventricle
Our case report highlights the surgical risk of rupture of associated arterial lesions, certainly related to per- and postoperative pulmonary arterial pressure variations
